intro: Lessingianthus heringeri, commonly known as the Heringer's sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the genus Lessingianthus. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its botanical structure supports pollination by insects, contributing to its ecological role in the region.
